annotation.TEXT: To be continued...
GAME SET!
Ah, I figured I could get a duder to respawn behind me, so my combo's not over yet!
It definitely looks neater like this.
Oh, this castle is so full of hot air.
Meh. I'd like to spin in time with the music, but I can't spin while descending, since I'm ducking.
Whoa. I almost mistimed that one. It looked like my feet touched that Thwomp, but I guess I didn't touch its hitbox!

So, the story starts off with the protagonist(s) heading off towards a strange castle with pretty much no real explanation why at this point. Also, you'll notice that the font is slightly thinner now, because I guess that's another thing that was changed last time, but loading my savestate didn't show this.

Ah, but the water graphics are now fully updated. Last time I showed this off, the top and bottom borders of the water were still using the original graphics, and I guess that's because I loaded from a savestate after that update.
Hmm... It appears 2-4's level dot on the map here still has those oddly-colored corners around it.
Hello, and welcome back to Super Marina World! So, there's been another update to this hack, and...
Just like last time, there's a message box that wasn't here before, which just states this simple fact.
Alright, so we've got autoscrolling, a Lakitu cloud, hot chocolate on the bottom and top of the screen, and wind.
Alright, I think that's it for the level revisiting. If I missed showing any English message boxes that were in any levels that I've already played, let me know!
Does everyone know what time it is? It's time to blow up a castle! And here's today's demolitions expert, Luica... no last name given. Here we go!
Well, I guess I don't need this cloud anymore, so... see ya!
...3-2's level name has been fixed as well! Alright! Now, there's something else I need to show, and to do that, I have to reset the game...
Don't rush for this ? block too quickly, because there's a loose ceiling spike to watch out for!

For these currents, enter the ones blowing up near the bottom of the screen, and for the one blowing down, enter it near the top of the screen. And obviously, move through these quickly. (But, don't get too ahead of yourself and run into the right edge of the screen while passing through these currents. That would be bad.)
Likewise, this wind can't quite push you into the floor spikes. (However, be sure to fight against this wind by pushing up, or else your ride will descend into the spikes.)
Hmm... Maybe that should say "THE NEXT STAGE IS THE BOTTOM OF THE OCEAN!", inserting "THE" before "BOTTOM OF THE OCEAN".
KA-BOOOOM!!!

Because, apparently, when I loaded from a savestate after the previous update, the floating water's updated graphics weren't entirely shown, and I guess it's because the current state of the graphics was saved with my savestate or something.
Don't let this wind scare you. It can't quite push you into the ceiling spikes on its own.
GO!
I've switched to normal speed now, because I'm starting a nice stomping combo here.
Next, let's check out 5-2...
Bah, I got hit at that part with the Chucks again (fortunately not by the blue things, though)!
Because, you see, I haven't shown off the story intro in English yet.
50-star goal tape hits: 8 Goal tape average so far: 2664 / 68 = 39.174 stars each.
Pop quiz: What game is this? First to answer correctly gets 5 Happy Smile points! UPDATE: virtualboy2558 got it. This is Terranigma.
Meh, only got 2 lives in that combo, since I wanted to avoid dying to the blue signals. Hmm... So, there's only one message box here this time...
...Same as before, this new message box just says this.
W-W-Whoa! J-J-Jittery! Why does that sometimes (but not always) happen when wind is blowing me into a ceiling?
...Or, maybe it's not so tricky, if the sprite limit suppresses the Bowser statue's fire...
And yes, I have no problem with using the left+right glitch now, since I've already cleared this level.
Alright, I think I've shown all I need to here. Now to reset the game again for a different reason...
And, once again, there's 11 levels for you guys to pick from (I wonder how long this number will stay at 11). So, place your votes, and we'll find out where I go next time!
So, by resetting the game and loading my file from the title screen, and then going to 2-4...
Well, that's awesome! Luica's first goal tape hit is a 50! Yay!
Well, that was fast. I don't think this message box was here last time...
This star coin might be a little on the tricky side to grab.
Yet another tricky star coin. Aim for the current on the right after getting it.
Yep, straight and to the point.
Now for the voting results...
Okay, looks like we're finishing up world 5 today!
And now, I'm sorry, but I'm loading my savestate again here. Now, I want to revisit a few levels to show off some message boxes in English, starting with 4-2...
BGM: Wild Arms 2 - Battle: Knight Blazer

I'm not going to keep separate bonus star tallies for each character though. (Maybe I would've if I had known about those character switch blocks from the beginning and had been switching between the two characters regularly from the start...)
There's loose ceiling spikes here, but if you're paying attention, they shouldn't be much of a threat.

Ah, but of course, it's the English translation we've already seen, except the bottom line has been changed from "BOROI NE!" to "WHAT A FRAGILE...". Hmm... I think that line would sound better as "HOW FRAGILE...".
Nope, looks like the explosion went off just fine... after a small unexplained delay. Alright everyone, let's give it up for Luica! ...Umm, Luica? Are you alright?
Man, I'm running out of room to place annotations down here during the voting results.
Oh, man. Lava, wind, and Centuar Man water. This wind is strong enough to support you without a cape, but having a cape is still helpful.
Alright, it's boss time, and I believe it's Roy, so let's take him out in less than two seconds flat!
Next on the agenda is 8-A...
Well, there's no message box right at the start (which is understandable, given how this level begins), so I'll just go to ludicrous speed until I reach it.

I'm sure Luica will be just fine. She just needs to clean up after that one. Okay, so now world 6 can be entered from the proper side. Let's go around and see which levels you guys can vote for this time...
There's another tricky star coin. Fall down (preferably float down with a cape), grab it, and then ride the current back up.
Ah, there it is, right near midpoint. And...
Okay, now here, don't even think about trying to take the lower route. Obviously, go over the top.
Total time it took me to deliver the finishing blow after I could start moving: 61 frames. D'oh! I just missed finishing him off within 1 second...
Carefully drop down onto the currents below to dodge these fishbones.
Maybe you guys should ease off a bit on the silly votes...
Oh, man. Bowser statues. They shouldn't be difficult to get past.

Okay, now I want to head to 9-8, because supposedly, there's been a change to the message boxes at the end of that level. If you recall, there was one box that was in Japanese, and one next to it that was an English translation.
6-life combo! (D'oh. Maybe could've gotten more if I was aware that guy would respawn again.)
...Yep, the typo in 4-B's level name has been fixed! In addition...
Zwee!
Whoops! I just boiled that flower... Oh, wait! It fell back into play!
Uh, oh. Was this one a dud?
